channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: News from the Ukraine battlefront some 5,000 miles away has dominated headlines and airwaves in Taiwan—and spurred new interest in battle readiness https://t.co/pMCZGFra44
Nuclear weapons were once thought to deter conventional conflict. Now Russia is using them to shield its aggression—an example China is watching. https://t.co/QY9zXvyhdt

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky brought up instituting a no-fly zone over Ukraine, but said, through a translator, “if you can’t do that, at least get me planes,” according to a person on the call. https://t.co/ewS9VpWmna
On paper, China’s banks and its homegrown payments system could offer Russia respite from crippling Western sanctions. In practice, it isn’t that simple. https://t.co/ihSHE3zxZL
How thermobaric weapons work https://t.co/8oDBZKEQU0
In the cobblestoned city of Lviv, resisting Russia was part of the local folklore. Now they're making Molotov cocktails out of craft-beer bottles. https://t.co/Zx4ZdZZX44
Canada is opening its doors to an unlimited number of Ukrainians fleeing Russia’s invasion https://t.co/zZu7z7T1dC
Here's what to know about Russian oligarchs and why they're facing heightened scrutiny by Western governments amid the Ukraine crisis https://t.co/9LTbTmJnbM

Visa and Mastercard are suspending their Russian operations. Among the debit and credit cards issued in Russia, Visa and Mastercard cards accounted for 74% of payment transactions in the country in 2020. https://t.co/XVXWO1sd4k
In 1862, Congress made paper money legal tender for all debts. What started as a way of paying for the Civil War ended up transforming the American economy. https://t.co/qEAfNhWnOn
The U.S. National Park Service has roots in the democratic idea that natural beauty should be preserved for public enjoyment. https://t.co/F84sQ9g6XQ
The U.S. is exploring a deal in which Poland would send Soviet-era aircraft to Ukraine in return for American F-16 jet fighters https://t.co/JV8E9aD9iB

The parents of Katie Meyer, the Stanford University soccer team captain who was found dead in a dormitory this week, said that a potential disciplinary action from the university might have contributed to her death https://t.co/2kucK9vqMl

From @WSJopinion: The Biden administration should see this conflict for what it is: a big Russian mistake, writes @ProfessorHannah. Putin’s overconfident assessment of his own power has been matched by his underestimation of Ukrainian resolve. https://t.co/uffT9dTFWl
Russia’s war on Ukraine has unleashed auto makers’ third supply-chain crisis in as many years https://t.co/K9FzCTRx7b
Wheat futures are at their highest levels since the global financial crisis, amid Russia’s war in Ukraine #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/7DRg459mPi https://t.co/NCg8YghicW
Naftali Bennett’s meeting with Vladimir Putin took place with the blessing of the U.S. administration, the Israeli prime minister’s office said. https://t.co/tPZF4GqtXY

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky asked for assistance in obtaining more lethal military aid—especially Russian-made jet fighters that Ukrainian pilots can fly—and supported a proposal to ban U.S. imports of Russian oil. https://t.co/HLwYvLkVVI

Aeroflot-Russian Airlines said it is suspending almost all international flights in response to government instructions, increasing Russia’s isolation from the global air transport system https://t.co/yZrWN5vnuC

From @WSJopinion: Ukraine’s fight for survival ought to give us some pause from the hysterical tenor of our domestic political debate, writes @gerardtbaker. It’s a reminder that freedom isn’t something we can take for granted. https://t.co/fkEYdaTy5z

Italian police said they seized a number of yachts and villas scattered around the country from wealthy Russian individuals targeted by European Union sanctions following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/pggcsF4GKa
“An awkward nexus.” Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin presented a united front against the U.S. on Feb. 4. That’s now proving a problem for China. https://t.co/FPDOgg46SD

U.S. drug regulators approved a new customized, cell-based treatment for blood cancer from Johnson & Johnson that is the first such therapy in the U.S. to be developed initially in China https://t.co/sJTmbUumgM

Broadcasters around the world are buying the rights to “Servant of the People,” an old TV show starring Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky as the Ukrainian president #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/KjIVhYDGXU https://t.co/ncRTLkNkX1
Ukraine is putting up as much of a fight against Russia in cyberspace as it is on the ground https://t.co/sY4DmqkSqo
More than 1.45 million people have left Ukraine, representing the largest and fastest displacement of people in Europe since World War II, the U.N. says https://t.co/cFK2tYe5bR
Get ready for a Sony car: The electronics maker is teaming up with Honda to start selling electric vehicles in 2025 https://t.co/S8BsL2g6q5

From @WSJopinion: The people of Ukraine are showing a too complacent West what it means to fight for freedom. The brave resistance to Putin is an inspiration and lesson to the world. https://t.co/6mhEThJra3

The world relies on the financial system’s plumbing—and as Russia has shown in the past week, a few concerted moves can flatten a major economy. “As investors, we need to look at things differently now.” https://t.co/gxJSbPwLt1
Russia demanded that Western sanctions over Ukraine wouldn’t prevent it from trading with Iran under a revived nuclear deal, potentially derailing the talks https://t.co/75NaVKkLpz
How Volodymyr Zelensky rose from television comedian to become Ukraine's wartime leader https://t.co/NtDWXCOwaL

How much oil does the U.S. import from Russia, and why? What might happen if the U.S. and other countries slow the flow of Russian crude? Here is a look at why the U.S. still imports Russian crude and where it goes. https://t.co/qSg003Vgd4
An agreement on evacuating civilians from two besieged Ukrainian cities collapsed, as Kyiv accused Moscow of violating the cease-fire https://t.co/Kg8IZmbuBP
Take a look at the front page of today's Wall Street Journal https://t.co/6Qd0STLl4K https://t.co/Zs5nZ9zHnC

China set an economic growth target of around 5.5% for the year, the lowest level in more than a quarter century of economic planning, reflecting heightened domestic and global uncertainties https://t.co/s68VJ82vBi

Hundreds of thousands of Ukrainian technology workers have taken part in cyberattacks against Russia’s government, media and financial institutions in recent days, a top Ukrainian cybersecurity official said Friday https://t.co/A6i6yrOHpB
Russia and Ukraine agreed to open humanitarian corridors for evacuating civilians from the besieged eastern Ukrainian cities of Mariupol and Volnovakha https://t.co/bKe6DhyH8H
Ukraine is putting up as much of a fight against Russia in cyberspace as it is on the ground https://t.co/7nDj0C4hu4
Ukraine has accused Russia of using thermobaric weapons. Here’s what makes them so devastating. https://t.co/j90tci1EzO

Russia’s initial struggles in its invasion of Ukraine have offered a vivid illustration to China’s leaders of the military challenges if they tried to seize control of Taiwan through force https://t.co/ZudFYm8cFM

China’s state-run broadcaster didn’t translate the International Paralympic Committee president’s remarks on war. English soccer broadcasts will also be blacked out this weekend. https://t.co/7cCoK2sHes
Here is an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal's weekend edition https://t.co/HNUJRh84dK https://t.co/tI3xnyvrEM
On paper, China’s banks and its homegrown payments system could offer Russia respite from crippling Western sanctions. In practice, it isn’t that simple. https://t.co/6AiI1Wjqvz
People around the world have booked over 60,000 nights in Ukrainian Airbnbs as a way to get aid to residents during the Russian attack https://t.co/IaKi6Ivftf

Bishop Gustavo Zanchetta, a longtime associate of Pope Francis, was convicted by an Argentine court of sexually assaulting young men in a case that has raised questions about the pope’s handling of sexual abuse at the highest level https://t.co/Czg9XNqqa1
News from the Ukraine battlefront some 5,000 miles away has dominated headlines and airwaves in Taiwan—and spurred new interest in battle readiness https://t.co/Q2jPINVmV2

A global watchdog censured the United Arab Emirates for not doing enough in confronting money laundering and terrorism financing activities, adding it to a list of countries requiring increased monitoring https://t.co/WHI74Hp36O
Heard on the Street: Sanctions on Russia have shown that central-bank reserves can be taken away—and China is taking note https://t.co/gveM3RbPMX

Turkish drones, American and British antitank weapons, and antiaircraft missiles, small arms and ammunition from other NATO countries have contributed to Ukraine’s unexpected ability to withstand the Russian assault https://t.co/l3QjFAzvWg
Experts say a big hunk of space junk just hit the moon. A NASA orbiter is being enlisted to confirm the impact. https://t.co/ioxihMUPLA
